The price is a little high but if you come to eat here once in a while it's not bad. Their recent shake of the month was Nutella banana and it was so amazing (and I don't drink shakes often!)

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella banana shake! It was Decembers shake of the month!

VX5WH8Unn1IhwFCypNKdWg.text: Burgers are amazing. Never had a patty seasoned so well. I like my burgers classic style so ordered the palace classic. Make sure you order your burger crunchified - it makes a huge difference. Ordered the black and white shake because I couldn't decide between the vanilla or the chocolate. It was one of the best shakes I've ever had. Couldn't decide on a side so ordered fries and sweet potato fries.  It was definitely a lot of food. Sat by the window and had so many people walking by and staring at the burgers. Worth checking out if you're a burger fan!

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries and sweet potato fries
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Black and white shake
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace classic

zLllZydhrQUheTEcrQiuMQ.text: Great place to stop by for lunch. Burgers are great and they have a burger it the month you can choose from also. You can order any burger crunchy for free and get potato chips added (which I did and it was pretty good).  The fries and manly onion rings were the star (plus the fry sauce... OMG). You can order a 1/2 and 1/2 and can try both. We did that it then ordered another round of onion rings, because onion rings are never amazing. The lunch crowd was in and the line was long, but customer service was great and the expo rushed out rings so we can eat them with our meal.  Will come back and definitely recommend to friends.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tables look into the kitchen and you can see the staff busting through orders no problem during lunch rush!
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch burger crunchy with turkey burger... Amazing. Get the egg runny!
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Half and half ... Reg fries and onion rings. Both were really good but onion rings were so good we had to order another round!

5uByvlPKzk42Okzzxjt_iA.text: I tried the New Mexico burger and it was so satisfying! I believe the price is lower than Gordon Ramsay's burger place. The place was not busy when I came and it is kind of hidden in the back.

o210jy3ABnidlv93bZgNTA.text: Brunch burger and veggie burger were outstanding!! And the mint chocolate chip shake was outstanding. The fries were okay at best.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veggie burger
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch burger
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EPaqwBoxWkjzjxgyQi3C5Q.text: This is one of the best burgers we've had in a long time OK Bobbe we need to see you in Houston Texas come on down

-cqB7I9Zh3_i2MTlPWAUrQ.text: Possibly the best burger I've had in a long time, hands down the worst service we've had in Vegas. Inattentive wait staff, broken and dirty bathrooms, etc. Was served a drink in a shattered glass, waitress plunked my drink down and the threw a straw at me. Asked for sauces that never came.

yZab6zjOCBl9pwPyZ-kpVQ.text: I'ma Bobby's fan. I like the speed of their service and that there's enough selection for everyone - but still not too much. I love the potato chips on the burgers touch. Kudos to whomever came how with that idea.  BBP is like chipotle for burgers. Bigger spaces than Chipotle too. I'm a fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1B6U88IT7vQyw_2MajIqOw.text: Will never come here again. My husband ordered his crunch burger medium, it came out well done with the topping half off on the plate. We sent it back to try and get a medium but it came out just the same, we gave up on it. My vegetarian burger I order with no cheese and no mayo, it came out with only a slice of tomato and a couple pickles and a sprinkle of lettuce(again half of the topping off on the plate). The other reviews were raving about mushrooms in it and that it was amazing.... mine seemed like it was just a bunch of quinoa smashed together(it was falling apart). The only thing they didn't mess up was the fries we ordered and onion rings. Not impressed to pay over $35 for just decent fries and onion rings.

nlZxHycp8iFFfbpcR3dTLg.text: My burger was cooked perfect medium rare.  Must try the jalapeno sauce.  Fries and onion rings are amazing. Visit Caleb at the bar, he is an awesome and gracious host with a lot of great information about the menu for my future visits I like to bring my friends here as I live here part time.

Qi__XVbIKnyfMQN0ibnpRA.text: Thank you son for taking me to Bobby's Burger place. Normally I would never go to the strip for a burger but I am so glad I did. The minute you walk in the door you smell the food cooking and your mouth starts to water. They have several types of burgers on the menu and fries and shakes and depending on your taste they also have turkey burgers. I had the crunchy bacon burger which was amazing. The burger was cooked perfect and I loved the chips on the burger. Definitely something different for me. The sauces they have to dip your food in and your fries are amazing. I love the Bobby's barbecue burger sauce and the chipotle ketchup on my gosh A must try. My brother had a jalapeno barbecue and he loved it. I also had the pumpkin shake which was very good and I love how they give you a Big straw so it's easy to drink. The service was great food an came out on time and was cooked perfect, as we all had different ways we wanted them cooked. The restaurant was very clean and very busy. I also love how you can sit at the bar and order your food as well instead of ordering it when you first come in. The only thing I found a little annoying was Parking. You have to park in the Aria parking garage to get to it because there's no parking on the street of course because it's on the strip.  Even with that it was still well worth it. Everything else was amazing. I never probably would have tried it if it wasn't for my son visiting and taking us there. But I can guarantee you I will be back Bobby burgers definitely represents Bobby Flay.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pumpkin spice shake
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Palace classic with  chipotle catch up

RoiZDDsmUC5QfOgXANI2cg.text: This was my first time visiting BBP. I was disappointed with the service and the ambiance. The cashier was not friendly at all. The food was ok nothing to rave about.

aa4B31w0M7LmKZYJDMywtg.text: Super convenient location, right on the strip in front of the City Center near Aria. Fantastic service. Everyone we encountered was courteous, helpful, and friendly. We ordered and had our food in a flash. They served my wine in a cute little plastic, BBP, to go cup.  Tasty burgers at reasonable prices. We chose the Bobby Bleu and the Philly. If I could figure out the magical seasoning formula, I would make it the mandatory mix for every burger in the world. My world, of course.  The onions and peppers accented the burger perfectly, without overwhelming it. All the various sauces were fun to sample.   I didn't find out about the whole crunchify thing until it was too late, but I probably don't need the extra calories anyway.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries with a tasty dipping sauce. They have chipotle ketchup at every table too.
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Dallas. Crunchified! Squashing it down is the best part.
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yoda enjoyed his wine while people watching.

eXAj6k9UrTkKIjatGEDHKA.text: I must first start by saying I am a big fan of Bobby Flay, so it hurts my soul to write this review.  This establishment was filthy!  Food on the floor, spots on the floor, and dirty chairs.  I saw crumbs all over tables,  I witnessed a server rake a few crumbs from the table on to the floor, then she must have realized there were too many so she took the menu and gathered them into her hand.  More crumbs still remained on the table, and at no time did I see a server actually use a towel to wipe down any of the tables.  I saw a patron come in and use a napkin to wipe the table she was sitting at, and I observed a server watch her do it and did not step in to clean.    If the front of the house is like this for all to see, I cringe at what may be happening in the kitchen.  Three stars because I enjoyed the LA burger that I had and the Margarita was tasty too.  Please, I ask that more attention is taken to cleanliness.  It was not crowded so there was no excuse for the condition of this place.  Although my burger was good, not sure if I would return based on the untidy atmosphere.

an-sB1BrF3MbwuiLGfiGew.text: So I'm in Las Vegas with my family.  They wanted burgers so I took the time to leave my hotel where there is a perfectly good Holstein's, downloaded the app, waited in a 15 minute line (only one person servicing the registers at dinner time) and then the scanner doesn't work so can't charge it to the app or receive my $5 credit.  In my line of work, if I don't deliver on a promise, I lose business.  I am writing this commentary from Holstein's back at the Cosmo hotel.  Wondering what thedo to make sure I ever return to a BBP location.  Update- Corporate asked me for my email address to forward to this location on January 3rd and then again on January 5th (not sure why two times).  I replied and I still have not heard back from this location.  I'm sure I will never go back to any Bobby Flay's locations.

QuYY-C5P6ex3MDU7bmdcIg.text: Smaller burger than I wished ( the only reason I gave 4 rather than 5 stars) but they were delicious. Get the lemonade for sure!

naYZh0c1hJkrrH9If7-nXQ.text: Amazing burger restaurant! The burgers are fresh and came out so quickly, even at 12:00 am. The staff was beyond friendly and the manager is amazing. Great first stop in Vegas

VHa0uR8tr8EaAx0KOa_Uow.text: If you love burgers and enjoy the option of choosing how it is cooked (medium rare, well...), you'll want to make a stop over here. Adults looking for a sweet and alcoholic treat, try the adult shakes. I highly recommend the Kahlua-Mocha Vodka shake. Overall, these menu items are delicious but tastes very similar to Red Robin burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kahlua-Mocha Vodka shake

j7WuaZeGjbj7jIJTzuf8eg.text: When Bobby Flay's name is associated with something you expect the highest quality and experience. I was expecting a great burger experience. We ordered the Philly and the Dallas. Both had well season good sized meat. The peppers on the Philly added flavor, there were too many onions and the bun was pedestrian. The bbq sauce on the Dallas was unremarkable and the Cole slaw was average. Same bun issue. Onion rings were good (not great) but a small portion soured is on them. Nothing wrong with the place as it's advertised as a casual burger bar. We just expected it to be outstanding and it wasn't.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Philly Cheese Burger
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Big, crispy Onion Rings...only 4 pieces
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Logo

yeyNpGkm9p1-CALE9QsL1A.text: Was really good. The hamburger was juicy full of flavor and the fries were tasty and Crip.

Zr9JIFfwIZiY6I_YssSbXw.text: Loved this place!! Their onion rings are the best so flavorful. Great shakes and loved the potato burger. If you are near here it's definitely worth a try. The service was also fast not much waiting and staff was very friendly.

OJu0qQDksZwKzpAdUpMzeA.text: Fan of Booby Flay & excited to try his famous burgers... sadly didn't meet my expectations.   Burgers itself were tasty but nothing special about the bun, fries or onion rings... $70 for lunch for 4  Management was great in fixing a few mishaps with our order and threw in a couple of shakes.  Oreo shake was spot on.

TPxShRvTK38MIOOchiNcCQ.text: I love Bobby Flay but why is this place not better????   I had the Dallas burger with bbq chips on the burger. That is the barque sauce and coleslaw on the burger. Everything on the burger was good but the meat felt really bland!  Whyyyyy????   I also ordered the dark chocolate shake and that is a no brainier. It was delicious. The fries were really salty and bland also! Whyyyyyy????  I want to love you! Let me love you!   Probably won't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dallas burger with Barbeque chips and dark chocolate shake.
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Dallas Burger with Barbeque chips!

snukZYH-fXWstJB54XUYQw.text: The wife wanted to experience all her favorite TV chef's cuisine during our recent trip to Vegas so we ventured to Bobby' Flay's burger joint for stop #1.   I expected more, especially for the lofty price. What we got was a couple of decent burgers, but nothing we couldn't get at a dozen other burger places, honestly I think Johnny Rockets has a much better burger. I got the Bobby's blue, and I am shocked to hear myself say this, because I love cheese, but this had too much cheese. Could not taste the juiciness of the burger it was so drowned in cheese. My wife had the classic which looked to me to be a fairly run of the mill burger.   We also ordered a half and half fries and onion rings and were presented with an anemic order of fries that was barely enough for 1 and TWO onion rings. The onion rings were not even the same size, bringing the spectre of conflict into the picture as the two patrons must then choose who gets the bigger one. C'mon, two freaking onion rings? This was a $5 side order and was supposed to be half and half. Perhaps the other half dozen onion rings were MIA, I don't know.   Service wise, the place was empty, but somehow our burgers came out 5 mins in advance of our drinks. Unacceptable. As for drinks, I ordered a strawberry shake, which taste wise was fine, but here again, the glass was not very large, it didn't come out with the metal carafe with the rest of the shake, and for 9 bucks I would have expected a hell of a lot more.   Summary, unless you are absolutely dead set on trying a Flay spot, pass on his palace, its extremely poor value, mediocre service and palatable but rather ordinary food.  Edit: I did get an almost immediate response from the BBP social media person promising they would address the shortcomings in my review with the LV location management. I will not change my review, but kudos to the social media manager for being on top of their feedback.

vPceZn85cjZBVjyQRNRAsw.text: Leonora our bartender is frickn  incredible! I'm a general manager of a restaurant in Denver and I wish I had her on my team. She was patient with us, and she walked us through the menu, she made sure that we were taken care of on everything that we needed, and on top of all of that she knew this mean you inside and out without having a reference that. I need somebody like her on my team!

4Sj9ijJGoygyYXsZg0zI6A.text: We ordered the Crunch Burger &  Onion Rings.  We split both and it was Delicious and More than enough...

oQzQVCsj5Q0QuHnzPDYDvw.text: Always wanted to try a Food Network chef's restaurant, so this was our chance. My husband, me and our 3 yr old daughter had a great experience there. The food was delicious. My husband had the Crunchburger, he ate up his burger in 5 minutes! I had the L.A. Bunless Burger. The burger without the bun in a mix of greens. We shared the fries and sweet potato fries. Best sweet potato fries I have had in awhile. It came with honey mustard and chipotle cream sauce. The decor is causal, loved the design of the eating bar. Definitely will go back!

oKD4sm1uPhc-yOPIchG1YQ.text: Outstanding burgers, friendly staff, casual dining.  Perfect!  I ate at several "celebrity" establishments on my last trip to Vegas, and this is the one I'd go to first next time!  This is a don't miss kinda place!

I1wErtOsmXoy_-Y7Tme2zg.text: Very yummy food for a quick stop on the strip! We are visitors to the Las Vegas area and had to stop in here, because we absolutely love Gordon Ramsey's BURGR, so trying out Bobby Flay's joint was a must! The burger combos are interesting, but neat and surprisingly good! The shake was good, but very overpriced for the size. The onion rings were amazing and the cheddar ranch was delish! Nice ambience for a quick meal too!

phbv7cFz3GJnn66ilIDdpA.text: Stopped in for an early lunch just after they opened.  It is located in front of The Mandarin and a short walk up from the Aria and City Center.  I love Bobby and wanted to try his burgers.  Knew I would crunchify anything I chose, why not?  It's  Bobby's signature burger move!  This is a walk in and order at the counter, they give you a number and then you find a seat joint.  There are long communal tables and round bar style tables.  I ordered the brunch burger medium rare which came with burger, fried egg, smoked bacon and American cheese.  Added lettuce, tomato and pickle at NO extra charge then crunchified it, also no charge.  Came out quickly and cooked perfectly.  The server that brought it to me said, "Good luck," which I am guessing is because I created a huge burger.  I pushed it down to allow the egg to crush and the chips and then dug in.  The meat was well seasoned and perfectly cooked.  The flavors were all perfect together.  The bacon was crisp and the lettuce and tomato were fresh.  We also ordered half fries and half rings.  Best onion rings!  Crisp, perfectly seasoned...just delicious.  The fries were great too.  All of the sauces on the table were tasty and fun to try.  I got to try Bobby's BBQ sauce, jalapeno sauce, Chipotle ketchup... all great with the rings and fries.  Burgers are all around $9.50 and the half and half side was $5.  All so reasonable!!!  All sooo yum!!!  I also liked the fact that it is really casual and they offer, beer, wine, margaritas and spiked milk shakes.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. LA burger with avacado relish that was delish, watercress and cheddar.  Simple yet very tasty.
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smashed my crunchified brunch burger with added lettuce, tomato and pickles.  Perfect fried egg!
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch buger customized.  Added lettuce, tomato and pickle then got it crunchified!

Mak3wzRW95VqVOk4b7wzSQ.text: My fiance and I came to Bobby Flay's burger joint because of me. I actually believed a celebrity chef's place would offer the best burgers in town. Well let me say we were both disappointed, and my fiance kept saying "You said these burgers would be good."  Well first off we were here once before for the Kahlua Vodka Mocha milkshakes. They are so good, so this time with our shake we decided to to try a burger and fries.   Our burger arrived without the fries.  When I looked at the receipt, i noticed we were not charged for it, and by the looks and the taste of the burger, my fiance, said, "forget it now, it's too late, and they probably will not be that good either."  The service is horrible all around. We watched our milkshake sit on the chef server counter for at least 10 minutes, and still none of the staff brought it to me, so I decided to go up and get it myself.  The burger was on a lousy cheap small bun, the kind you would get at McDonalds. The size of the burger was not much bigger than a regular burger at McDonalds either, but for almost 10 bucks, not including the fries, which are $4 extra.  No use thinking about the fries that we didn't get anyway. Let's go back to the burger. It was very salty and skimpy and someone in the kitchen has a heavy hand with the salt.   There were two guys sitting next to us who were also disappointed in the same way. They said they came because of good reviews on Yelp, but after seeing the size of the burgers and then tasting them, they claimed that the Yelp reviews were BS, and they must be staged, as part of some marketing ploy by a marketing company posing as legitimate patrons, or employees of the restaurant.  You would imagine that Bobby Flay would give his patrons a good thick juicy burger that is perfectly seasoned, considering his reputation and the price, but no!   Maybe he wants to pretend the joint is in Paris, but even in Paris at good burger places, you can find a much tastier bigger burgers.  I asked the staff if Bobby Flay ever comes to the restaurant to check on it, and they claim when he does he works in the kitchen, so I am not sure if this is his recipe done correctly, or how he runs his restaurant, or if it's a case of the "When the cat's away, the mice will play."  I have not tried anything but the Kahlua Vodka Mocha milkshake and the burgers, so I can't say anything for now about the french fries or onion rings, but if the burgers they serve is any indication of what the rest of the food would be like, my fiance and I both agree, save your money and go somewhere else, especially if you know good food, this was a complete disappointment.   Bobby Flay or no Bobby Flay, this restaurant will not stay in business long with the horrible service and the quality of the burger and bun.  We say stick with the milkshakes if you do decide to eat here!

-SOiU1k7nLGr36zSIlHDww.text: My family was super-excited to eat here, but today it missed the mark.  Burgers were beyond too salty -- it was inedible.  Could be a fluke so we'll give it another try next time.

e9t4p3JZFU9ncEXp4iEhhA.text: Bobby's Burger Palace is Amazing!!  I found Bobby's Burgers on the day I was scheduled to fly out and decided to extend my vacation for an extra 9-days just so I had time to try the entire menu.  Seriously it's all good. The brunch burger is my personal favorite.   All of the burgers are good enough that they don't need extra sauce but the Burger Sauce sitting on your table is good enough that you should just try a taste anyway.

EL__tyaePJB9fDi7jVgwpQ.text: Sadly, our first cuisine stop in Las Vegas was a bit of a disappointment.  While having two lines for eating in and take out is great.. if you are not manning the "take-out" line... you better have some kind of signage that points that out to people!  Starting off 5 minutes later.. we ordered, I went with the original crunch burger, and the girlfriend opted for a more "spicy" option of the Vegas burger (when in Rome right?)  We took our seat and enjoyed a bit of some great music, and the food arrived in a suitable amount of time.  Not incredibly impressive for what we paid (almost 30 dollars).. my burger was a lame little burger with plain potato chips on it. I know.. Bobby Flay tries to paint it as more.. but it's not much else. The giant pickle is the most impressive part of it.  The girlfriends was much of the same.. a pathetic little burger with a stack of BBQ chips on top...   It was an interesting concept.. but really I feel like I could do it myself like that for much less, and might even taste better. My burger was just an unseasoned beef patty, and the chips just overpowered anything else with the amount of salt on them. Just meh.  My girlfriend, a couple of bites in.. started to complain about the heat of the burger (spiciness)... and took the Fresno red chilies.. which (and I love heat) were uncomfortably hot. It hurt somewhat to chomp them down for her.. but we did finish them off.  Overall just an over priced joint with average food. The one saving grace was the tunes playing.

qHTPHDJBs58HJCt6K6epNQ.text: I had the brunch burger (egg &bacon). The burger was good but nothing really special. The onion rings were out of this world good! I will be back for the rings, they're the one rings to rule them all!

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch burger with a side of onion rings.

8y8H66SGNBFAE35IPndDOA.text: Best burger on the strip, let alone Vegas.   It is actually for reasonably priced for Vegas.  Great sides too.  Highly recommend.

mH1jI7qBF-H1QusAOW9wpQ.text: When I saw the place, I immediately wanted to try it out. Well, I was disappointed with the whole meal. The burgers were overcooked and very salty. And do not get the onion rings! I don't even know if you can call them onion rings. The coating was way too thick!

C3-y5xitd7p7pAnVO5IaEg.text: This place has great food but they are understaffed and very very slow. Literally sat with 4 people in front of me for 26 minutes to order!! Not get served!! Order. One cashier who seems competent but it's a grind to get an order in. Also after waiting for a very very slow order.. then finally get to front and the cashier takes a phone order for 7 minutes. This place is stealing money. If you don't hire enough people.

D8PAhxnCtrgxZKumAAKYAQ.text: Holy cow this place is not good compared to the one I've visited in NJ.  The burger isn't cooked to one temp as NJ's location informs you this is how it's cooked is that okay?   The next is that I ordered the onion rings and sweet potato fries. The fries were awesome and the burger was okay. I also ordered a shake and it kick butt however the onion rings were like onion rings that had been served and were not eaten so they battered then and fried them again. The coating on the rings was so damned thick and layered I'm almost positive that they are recycled but I can't say for certain.  The place is currently under some type of renovation with yellow tape roping a lot of the dining area off but there was plenty of room and the burger and fries were edible. The onion rings were not even something I'd feed my dog and sadly the burger was overlooked. I had really expected quite a bit more being a Vegas destination.  I wouldn't steer clear but I would go in with my expectations somewhat managed.

mPrnGKE0Vl-b1y0NO6meOg.text: I had the Philadelphia burger with onion rings. The burger was good however the bun was a disappointment. It would have been better if the bun wasn't flimsy/soggy. It just didn't hold up to the meat, provolone , grilled onions & peppers. The pickle was huge and really good. The onion rings weren't all that great either.

kXMs8Goqh8rxX8Lbqjx6NQ.text: Probably one of the best burgers I have EVER had. The staff is so unbelievably friendly. Enzo our waiter was attentive and fast. Fries and sauces were delicious. My wife and I had the turkey burger and it was awesome! A must if you're visiting Las Vegas and are craving a good burger!

MW4v-k1zg9kbq-tKGAQ6tQ.text: Horrible. Ordered a blue cheese and bacon burger medium rare and got a well done, tasteless abomination. I had a better tasting, juicier burger at an airport Chilli's today. The sweet potato fries were only slightly better. The chipotle ketchup and "burger sauce" where very good.   Won't go back and not recommended.

956emIqaEuq_S9FKVDIpNQ.text: Awesome service and even better burgers! The best sweet potato fries I've ever had. Everything is clean and we lived the atmosphere.

uqG0D2D09i_0TS-qEsfI7g.text: Oh man, what a burger! I loved BOBBY'S BURGER PALACE! I went there for a quick lunch while in Vegas and left very pleased!  I ordered the "Classic Burger, Crunch Style" which is double American cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion and the crunch... potato chips!! Dude, those chips sealed the deal. It was one fantastic burg. They also had a bunch of specialty sauces at the table. Bobby's steak sauce, chipotle ketchup, to name a few. I washed down the meal with a Stone IPA.  My wife had the Crunch Salad with Chicken and loved it as well.   What I also liked is it didn't break the bank. You order at the counter and don't have a server, so it can be seen as a step above fast food. But overall, I was stoked and would go back again.  4.5 stars!

e8usNybWP0mRiec1b0Xvgw.text: Some of the best beef I've ever had. No bullshit. Had the Carolina and New Mexico, both were fantastic. The cactus pear margaritas are amazing. The server bragged about the 9 bottles of pure agave in the machine and judging by the flavor and effect, I believe him. Fantastic service. I hate Vegas, and I'd almost go there just to eat here. Love it.

aMqlk3rIPuBoPfG_6UePxw.text: This place was fantastic! The people are very nice and accommodating. Me being vegan ordered the veggie burger with no cheese. The waitress let me know the patty was also coated with an egg wash before fried and that the sauce has mayo in it. Thanks for that! (Lol) Our food took a little while to come out because they had to make a fresh patty but the wait wasnt anything more than 10 mins. Anyway, the quality was amazing and the amount of food was filling. Price is right as well.. highly recommend!!

s_60X7zMx3etAqOd1PbCXQ.text: We live in a small town with so so restaurants so when we travel, it is all about the food. We are in Las Vegas. I am looking at all the choices for food and my wife wants to go to Bobby's Burger Palace. Bobby's Burger Palace? I can get a hamburger anywhere, but I gotta keep mama happy. We were staying at the Aria so it was a 5 minute walk. We arrived late...about 9:00pm. Only a few other people in the place. We walked up to the counter and ordered. My wife got the Bobby Blue and I got the Brunch Burger. We also got a combo of fries and onion rings. I wanted one the their spiked milkshakes, bourbon, rum or vodka...but I can't have dairy. I just had a beer. Now...when I said I could have a burger anywhere.....not like this. This was the best hamburger I have ever had, and I have had plenty. This food was off the hook. Best hamburgers we have had, fries and onion rings were also amazingly yummy. Bobby Flay lives up to his reputation with this place.

QHqPRuxbbxO1cpqjAvlA5g.text: I am a fan of Bobby Flay.  And because of that - I was pretty sure that my hopes were too high for his burgers.  I had the Palace Classic - American cheese, lettuce, tomato and red onion.  You can pick beef, turkey or chicken.  For beef - you can choose temp of burger.  I had a medium burger and it did not disappoint! It was the seasoning of the burger itself.   The toppings are just toppings but if the burger can stand alone - then it's a good burger.  Also tried the bacon cheese fries.  Yum! Overall - excellent quick meal right on the Strip!

rlAt9FJWgjEgAB7Umznu1g.text: Awesome burger place.   From the staff to the food .   Bobby flay hit it on the nail.  Burgers were not greasy and the sides were awesome

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zAOuvRbekLadtKUIsNmcwQ.text: Pretty good.  Fries were tasty but a little cold.  Asked for a medium well burger and got medium(fine by me, girlfriend wanted it overcooked).  Soggy bacon.  Their credit card system is goofy and their ordering process is slow.  Other than that, burger was thick and tasty, and the shake was great.  I'd definitely come back if I was staying in this part of the strip again, but I wouldn't seek it out.

1u1llKcyZ3JrNDkv50wJ1g.text: Was so looking forward to a really great burger and was extremely disappointed.  Burger was dry with no flavor, the bun and toppings were less than exciting.  I liked the onion ring batter, but onions inside were extremely thin.

UWQSyl24Nn3BcgPWQd0P5A.text: One of the best burger places on the strip, I'd even argue that it is the best the lemonade is very good, the customer service is top notch, and the burgers are out of this world, if you're on the strip looking to get a quick bite definitely consider Bobby's Burger Palace.

ruZj6rGkztsSNIMfvZPX3g.text: Better than a food court but not by much.  Part of a growing chain (18 restaurants in 11 states).  It's not fancy.  No build your own anything.  Make a "concept" selection, choose either burger, chicken, or turkey.  For beef burgers, choose a doneness level.  Opt for plain or "crunchified" (silly addition of chips in the sandwich).  Done.  The decor looks like a burger exploded.  Ketchup red, mustard yellow, golden bun, grilled beef brown.  Burgers are cooked to order, relatively juicy, decent beef flavor but grossly under seasoned.  Not good for mild burgers but welcome for spicy creations which are SPICY.  Toppings are fresh.  The Philadelphia Burger (provolone, griddled onions and hot peppers) packs a spicy punch but is good eats.  The LA burger (avocado, watercress, tomato and cheddar cheese) is so mild the burger is lost.  Definitely NOT a fan of the "crunchified" burgers.  The addition of chips adds a distracting textural contrast and nothing to the taste.    Simple sides.  The beer battered onion rings best of the bunch.  Fries just OK.  Soggy at times.  The mayo, roasted red pepper, chipotle sauce it's served with is spicy and flavorful.  The sweet potato fries with honey mustard horseradish sauce is a better choice.  Very good, rich milk shake with pronounced flavors (the pistachio is worthy!)  Excellent service.  Overall, inexpensive for the Strip but not worth the pilgrimage or the wait.  This is Vegas.  X times the money does equal X times the pleasure.

MVoYifo900Fsr7viAO0BjQ.text: If my meal here was a person, then that means they looked straight into Sodom and Gomorra and turned into a pillar of salt...   Let me start off by saying I loved the atmosphere and the convenient location of the soda fountain. The interior is very retro-mod, and very stylish! Each table has an extensive array of unique sauces to compliment your meal.  I had the "Bobby Bleu" ($9.50) which is a bleu cheese burger with bacon (I only got it because it was the only option on the menu with bacon beside the one with egg in it :::yuck!:::) It was delicious! I loved it, aside from the part I felt like I just deep-throated a salt-shaker. I also had the crunchburger option, which was to add chips, and I really enjoyed that along with the flavor of the meat itself.  The beer battered onion rings were not the business... I seriously saw LUMPS of salt adhered to each piece. I only had one piece and couldn't finish the rest. These were $4 for about 5 pieces...  The service was great, but I don't think I would be back to Bobby's Burger Palace unless someone's treating me! Haha. I ended up spending a little under $20 on a burger, fries and a small fountain drink... I pay about $11 in Los Angeles for the equivalent at Hook Burger, sans the potato chips.

lR2S9h2laTNMcTAANTJf-w.text: After reading my review again i wanted to clarify that, compared to other places in Vegas the price of my meal was actually pretty average. My mind set was comparing the meal to one from my home town which would have been much much cheaper.  I hope this helps.

Uz204y7TqN_ljFq3iqfg9A.text: Burgers so good they made me want to fight my friends. Five stars for the very testostronous meal.

_0Zj4WOcf20vNKzYYfO5HA.text: Finally, a reasonably priced gourmet burger spot in the center of the Las Vegas strip! Located right next door to Pinkberry, BBP is sitting immediately in front of the Mandarin Hotel. If you valet at Mandarin, you can walk right into BBP....only a few steps away. If you feel like self parking, Aria will do the trick...just a bit of a walk. All the food is priced higher here in comparison to the online menu. Not a big deal considering the location and prices of their competition, but just know and expect it. Once you walk in, your order at the counter and get a number...they bring the food out to you. There are napkins and lots of house-made sauces sitting on the tables, so it's far from full service but with plenty of helping hands around to answer questions or to remove plates. On to the food! New Mexico Burger ($9.50): Queso Sauce, Pickled Red Onions & Pickled Jalapenos. This was very good! Initial juices flow out on the squeeze, the burger was cooked perfectly (MR), and the toppings added lots of flavor! Wish their Queso sauce was a bit thicker like their Mesa Grill counterpart....which this reminded me of strongly. A pic for comparison : s3-media3.ak.yelpcdn.com... French Fries ($4) with BBP Fry Sauce. These were cooked well-done+...not sure if they are supposed to be that crispy, or if mine were cooked too long. The fry sauce is good, kind of like a mayo/chile aioli. Wish they were seasoned a bit more like Mesa Grill's Southwestern Fries...those are delicious! Or at least give us an option for a seasoned fry :) Vanilla Bean Milkshake ($6.50) with Whipped Cream. This was very creamy and rich...easy to drink! Wish there were adds like Nutella, Chocolate or Oreos though! So overall, a very good burger at a good price! I'd recommend it esp if you are walking around on the strip :P

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House-made sauces! The chipotle ketchup is pretty tasty :)
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Closeup on the New Mexico Burger. So much different flavor combinations...works out perfectly :)
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New Mexico Burger ($9.50): Queso Sauce, Pickled Red Onions &amp; Pickled Jalapenos. This was very good!  Very juicy &amp; lots of flavor

SMBVne5Hu2t1Xs5dN2S4hg.text: In Las Vegas, there is not such a thing as "too many" burger joints. So with that said, welcome Bobby Flay, and your addition to the Las Vegas strip. Thank you for bringing a decent priced, good quality burger to my place of residence!  We have Burger Bar, Strip Burger, KGB's, BURGR, and many more I haven't mentioned. All of them have a good quality burger, and everyone has their favorite.  I am happy to say the Burger Palace can easily be added to this list!  Decisions are the hardest on a first visit. We went with the Brunch burger and Philly burger both crunchified. (Added homemade potato chips). A fries, and onion rings, and a pistachio shake.  The shake was delicious and I will come back for that alone.  I like my burgers well done, and I like when a place successfully still makes a juicy well done burger. I'd say this needed about 2 minutes less cook to be perfect but it still was good. The sauces on the table were great, but the real winner is the honey mustard horseradish that you have to ask for.  All the ingredients on the burgers were fresh, and you could tell. The cheese was high quality and melted off the sides of the burger.  I ate every bite, and was perfectly full.  Also, they give you a points card, where every dollar spent is a point and at $100, you get a free burger. We spent $40 so within a 3rd visit you will earn that burger. It is free, so definitely worth it.  Can't wait for a second visit, and this I would choose this place over at least half of the other burger joints in this city. Great food, service, and prices!

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pistachio shake.
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fries
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onion rings

wi7eIgjBVaqT9WUdTvabWA.text: Surprise, surprise! Bobby's Burger Palace is serving up delicious burgers, on the strip, and not charging crazy high prices! Is this real life?  While they may be going for the "gourmet" burger category, it isn't quite like any other gourmet burger spot on the strip. When you walk in, there's a huge menu on the wall and a counter to order at. Unlike a lot of other spots that are full service, at BBP, you just order and they bring it out to you.  There are several options on the menu for burgers. If you're not the burger type though, you can order any burger style but swap out for a different protein. Alongside the certified angus beef, they offer ground turkey and whole chicken breast. The rest of the menu features sides, salads, sandwiches and beverages. Since they're on the strip, they're also serving up beer and spiked milkshakes.  I decided on the Crunchburger, a simple burger with double American cheese and topped with potato chips. I've gotten in the habit of trying just the meat every time I get a burger somewhere and BBP's was great. The meat was tender and seasoned very well. It seems like they are a little heavy on the pepper but I actually enjoyed it like that. I wasn't a huge fan of the bun though as it was a bit dry. Altogether it was a great burger but I'd like to see them use house made chips to top it. I could be wrong but they sure tasted just like plain ole Lays. It also needed a sauce but luckily each table has a few to choose from and their jalapeno hot sauce really set the flavor off.  We also ordered The Half & Half sides with fries and onion rings. The fries are delicious. They actually fry them a bit on the harder side so they are a nice, crispy brown on the outside but still soft inside. I'd like them to be a bit saltier but they are served with a really tasty fry sauce anyway. It's a mayo based sauce with red pepper that is creamy with a very slight bit of kick. I think it would actually be really good on a burger.  One of my favorite parts about BBP was several little signs they have up front indicating how they cook their burgers. I ordered mine medium, my wife ordered hers well done...they cooked them right and exactly how it says on those signs. To me, that's a great thing, it saves a lot of headache, and possible stomach aches. And even though they aren't full service, everyone was very nice and happy to get anything you need or answer any questions. To top it, we walked out of there for under $30. If you're on the strip and craving a burger, give BBP a try!

AqHDx-JIqoABl6zbc-CkvA.text: BOBBY FLAY IS THE MAN... I swear I drool everytime I watch him cook on the food channel. I was super looking forward to trying his new burger spot on the strip....... Meh. I mean I wasn't disappointed because it's not like it was terrible, but it wasn't as bomb as I expected neither.  Located in front of the City Center next to Starbucks. Pretty casual spot; decently priced. I got the Philadelphia and my friend got the Los Angeles. Both were average... simple. I'd skip this and just go for Gordon Ramsay.

aEZSSEItttJ7yBk0_Df9AA.text: Now this is a burger place. I ordered the crunch burger and it was great! The meat was filled with flavor and thick, possibly half pound burgers. It was definitely bigger than a quarter pound. Then the different sauces at the table was great to place on the buns. Everyone was so happy with there meal. The fries tasted freshly cut and had a good amount of salt. This in my opinion is the best priced burger joint on the strip.  Also the best tasting burgers

SS_GowGjU1S-yHnbT_tA9g.text: We just eat at Bobby' s burger place in Vegas and encountered a little critter....too bad, not a clean place

Bouuvvwrb1l1B4kh-O1RlA.text: We went at 6pm on a Saturday night and the place was half empty. But after wading through masses of crowds all day and bleary eyed from cigarette smoke, this was a warm and welcome oasis! (I could hear myself think and relax without any bumbling, drunk idiots further north on the Strip.) I ordered the Dallas angus beef burger with the "can't decide" - sweet potato fries and onion rings. My daughter ordered the kid-friendly crunch burger. Great that you can choose ground turkey or chicken breast, in addition to the angus beef, which was a perfectly juicy medium-well.  Loved the various sauces Bobby Flay's known for: spicy jalapeno, creamy BBQ, smoky chipotle ketchup, sweet mustard, and even the ranch was the best I've ever tasted! The onion rings were crispy with a nice, peppery crunch. I also got the frozen pink margarita- it had a very smoothly blended ice texture, and was so delicious! My burger was a scrumptious balance of sweet, tangy, and spicy. Total tab without the tip for two burgers, regular fries, the "can't decide", a bottle of water, and margarita, was $42. I'd say this place seemed really kid friendly, could be a cozy date place, and the long tables were great for large groups of family or friends. The only reason I'm not giving 4 stars is due to the soggy, thin, bottom bun. I took it off because it was overly mushy from all the juices that came out of my burger. The service was attentive and excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. &#34;Can&#39;t decide&#34; onion rings and sweet potato fries, and frozen margarita.

vEIb2UI121jWsUGVYf5xng.text: Overall, the food was good. We ordered the LA Burger, grilled cheese, and mix of sweet potato fries and onion rings. All were delicious. I wanted a veggie burger, but they were sold out, which was disappointing. Overall, this was a good place for a quick lunch. The woman who took our order was super nice and the woman who delivered our food was super friendly as well.  It's hard to know whether this restaurant has waiter service or not. You order at the counter and then find your own table, but after paying the cashier tells you that tips are appreciated at your table for your waiter. You get your own drinks and refills, but someone brings you your food. I don't think this constitutes as a waiter. Some of the waiters topped off their customers drinks, but no one did this for us. We went through the end of our meal with no water because the machine ran out and no one came to fill up our waters. For not having the veggie burger in stock and not having enough water for the meal is the reason for 3 stars.

p6O2giNxxbY_AUSzwToKug.text: I will give this place 3 stars because the crunchy chopped salad was very good (minus the bitter red cabbage). It had a lot of different ingredients in it (garbanzo beans, avocado, won ton chips, etc.) and the dressing was yummy. I also liked the overall ambience of the place. Very open, clean and trendy.  However, I ordered a cactus pear margarita.. it was the worst margarita I've ever tasted. Although it was pretty, there was no cactus pear flavor at all. It tasted as if someone had just blended tequila and ice and poured it into a cup. I didn't bring this to their attention because I was just over it by this point. I'm sure they would have done something to fix it but it was just beyond repair.

6p78lVtGVynJZTp-ElsRKQ.text: What is not to love about Bobby Flay? Absolutely nothing! And his burger place is the bomb,I was in heaven since I am Bobby's super fan, it looks like a fast food place but with class, with an 80's vibe decor, they have pictures of Bobby Flay's quotes in the walls and I loved it!! Very affordable prices, and tasty burgers and fries, we ordered two classic palace burgers without the onion, my friend had the well done and I ordered the medium rare which was juicy and delish and perfectly cooked, we got the undecided side which was half onion rings and half sweet potatoes fries, and it was enough for the two of us to share, all the sauces were in the table, everything was sparkling clean, great costumer service, friendly staff and helpful when we asked them about the menu, I even asked them if they knew Booby and they told me: of course he is the coolest boss ever, he pays unannounced visits here an there (hopefully I will be lucky enough to see him one day)and I absolutely believed them!! It must be a dream come True to work for a celebrity chef like him! I can't wait to find out what other Bobby Flay's owned restaurants have to offer! But this one right here I will come back again if life bring me to Vegas in the future!! A place worth to try in Vegas Strip my dear Yelpers!

u_60uDYTAAl_Rf75gJg0SA.text: Yum! Overpriced but everything on the strip is. Pacific Northwest burger of the month for September was so good! We opted for sweet potato fries but saw a number of diners getting the onion rings and they looked super tasty! Love all of the sauce choices at the table.

7l0QavqAhjokoOkV7l_hJw.text: We stopped here for lunch right after we arrived in Vegas. I ordered the burger of the month, the Mulberry Street Burger, which had fresh mozzarella, basil ketchup, parmesan cheese, and baby arugula and I swapped out the burger for chicken. I really hope BBP makes this a part of their regular menu, it was delicious! Nothing was really hitting me on the regular menu, so when my friend pointed this out on the sign, I immediately decided that's what I was going to get and it did not disappoint!  We were given a number and sat down and the food was brought out. The one issue was the timing was a bit off. I placed my order right before my friend did, but I had completely eaten my sandwich by the time hers came out. The waitress did apologize though. My only other suggestion would be for another side option besides pickles to be offered.   Overall, the chicken breast was very moist and I loved the combination of flavors, especially the basil ketchup and parmesan cheese, I was trying to wipe up every last bit of the sauce on my plate with my bun!

RDE5PdRstHG3r2bCika_hQ.text: Visiting from Ma. All I have to say is I've had many burgers in my life but never as good as this. Bobby is a flavor creator. My classic burger was made with the best quality meat and it was extremely juicy! My husband also enjoyed the brunch burger. The sauces were an added bonus, loved trying each one.

bfun0Z5niUuCBcUVGPG-UQ.text: When I came to Vegas I had to make a stop at BBP and check out what I've been missing. I ordered the Dallas burger.  It had some good flavors. Wasn't a fan of the chips that came on the side. I would come back and try something different.

ac4GF-0rTjyPBElGpjzGiw.text: Today was my first place at Bobby's Burger Palace and I have to say that my experience was on point. The food was incredible, the atmosphere  was great, and my service couldn't of gotten any better. I walked in and was treated with a cheerful face right away. I chose to sit at the bar and the bartender was such a pleasure to speak to. I don't remember her name but I know she was new, her first day bartending actually. I had questions about the menu and she helped explain to me what came on the burgers as well as she gave me  recommendations. I enjoyed the food, the decor of the cool tables but my service is truly the reason that I will be coming back. I hope all your workers are as great as she was. 5 stars for this place isn't enough! Absolutely loved it!

jxN348-lp8-zQzSavBaYpg.text: Amazing burgers!  Great taste! This is my second time and the best burgers ever.  Love it!

ba9yL2YCfnIaCcWvu48yMg.text: Absolutely, hands down the best burger I have ever had!  It was so good I stopped talking to my friend and descended into a grunting moaning fool for a few minutes.  I can't recommend this burger enough. LA burger, medium.

IDRDpRk-1k0MuHjUdwYmdQ.text: On a recent trip to Vegas I decided to try a couple of burger places. The decor of the place is lacking in style. It has that 70's Art Deco style. It had a fried chicken coating  that was super crunchy, but I don't think it works on Onion Rings. The Sweet Potato Fries were great. k-Udp3AXjGEPZRAdqW4byA.text: We were exciting to try bobby flay's burger palace but it was a completely disappointing, the host was rude , service was super slow even when the place was empty ( on a Saturday night! ), patties were flavorless and the bun was a big mistake, we will not be back here anytime soon .

D1pBaHXUzogL-TKIOE9x2g.text: What the f%#@$ with this place, here on a Sunday night, maybe about a dozen customers eating, they are so short handed or just slow as molasses. Been waiting at the register for 10 minutes to order and nobody in sight, people in front of me have been waiting 20 minutes for their to go order, guy finally comes out and says " we are not taking orders right now " are you kidding me !!! Been here before and nothing like this, yes their burgers are good but service just sucks. Needless to say I left empty handed, maybe I'll go across the strip to Ramsey's burgers, maybe they have time to take my order.

w9VpbH8JMI27_CYwsAlOlg.text: I met up with a friend visiting from out of state on a Saturday for lunch at Bobby's Burger Palace. Located along the Las Vegas Strip at the Waldorf Astoria (formerly the Mandarin Oriental), this is a counter-service casual burger spot owned by celeb chef Bobby Flay.   After you order and pay at a register,  you receive a number and find your own seating. I personally found the stools a bit uncomfortable, but I did like the bright, modern decor.   As for the food, burgers come with your choice of beef, turkey or chicken. You can also specify how you want your burger cooked, which isn't always an option for customers at burger places for some dumb reason.  You can add crunch (potato chips) for free. Do it. Even if you are skeptical, it's really good.  I had the Palace Classic Burger, which is just a cheeseburger with the basic vegetable toppings, served with a pickle spear. My burger was thick and juicy, a nice size for $8.50. Burgers come without condiments but there are a variety on the table, including chipotle ketchup and burger sauce.  Sides include regular or sweet potato fries and onion rings. The onions rings were very thick cut, I wasn't a fan of them.. but I loved the sweet potato fries with the delicious honey mustard dipping sauce. Grilled cheese, a salad and a veggie burger are also on the menu for non-burger fans.  Service was good, food was brought out fairly quickly and an employee stopped by to see how we were doing.  A party of three each had a burger, three sides and one soda for under $50, which is not bad for the Strip. I would return to Bobby's Burger Palace if I was on the Strip and craving a burger.   Yelp Reviews 2019 3/100

MX027I8k7Yx2ujamLhoBGw.text: Located on the Strip right next to Aria and Park MGM. Ordered the Bacon Crunch Burger with Onion rings/Fries. Food came out fairly quickly.  Burger was delicious and the potato chips made it a lot better with a contrast of textures. I enjoyed every bite of it and will come back.

jIdZ_yFSUuWIDJ6fohetzw.text: Arrived just before 9 with no cashier to take an order.  I was behind one other person.  Finally ordered and then waited another 25 minutes just for a shake to go.  On top of that there was only one server seen in the restaurant working and my order came with whipped cream when I asked for none.

stGNcnAF4GCV1q8q0x9gTw.text: Delicious food, I had the crunch burger with potato chips, it was an interesting combination. The dill pickle was crisp and sour. They cooked imy burger to a perfect medium rare. The prices were really reasonable but the service was so great! Lola was so pleasant, happy and attentive a very rare occurrence in the service industry these days.

dspZX-CKJ60lARbbmBvtyQ.text: I was pleasantly surprised by this place.  I have seen his TV show and after a couple of episodes I couldn't watch it again, but his burger joint is something I'd go back to.  First I'm on a low carb diet, and if I hadn't have been staying at the Waldorf I wouldn't have eaten here. The lady at the counter was exceptional, she knew the menu and explained the no bun option.  The burger was excellent, cooked perfectly to order and the sweet potato fries were spot on, the mustard sauce they came with definately had some mustard in it, unlike many that are just flavorings.  The atmosphere is relaxed and the time I went there was ni wait at all.  Great food for a great price.  If you're on the strip and looking for something tasty, that won't empty your wallet, then give this place a try.

CIXQCRyeUeDqNtniJ4fyuA.text: Another restaurant with great food but slow service. I asked to have a veggie patty added to my salad which turned into a bit of an ordeal. The woman at the register had to ask the manager and then kept repeating to me that "they don't usually do that," and kept making it seem like I was out of line for asking, even though I repeatedly told her I would pay the difference. Frustrating but after riding the struggle bus we figured it out!   On the plus side, the food came out quickly and it was delicious!! Big portion and the veggie patty was thick, flavorful, and on point! (If you're vegan be sure to ask for no cheese).   The restaurant is laid back with a bar and large tables so you can bring in a big group or share a table with strangers. Kind of fun! Not a great spot for an intimate moment but lots of options and worth checking out.

W1R0IGhNDdVfCcfasaMWGw.text: Burger review incoming:  Rating: 7.3   Honestly I was kind of underwhelmed by this burger. I had the brunch burger at @bobbysburgerpalace in Las Vegas.  I expected a tad more because it is "Bobby's Spot" I had the brunch burger "crunchified." Bacon could have been crispier, bun was okay and the burger itself was pretty good.   That all being said the customer service and staff were outstanding. Special thanks to Stephanie and Jennifer for taking care of us this evening.    More reviews on instagram - foodingwithbobo

_oqOyUPmwIcn3Kn_8eMp4w.text: Honestly the best veggie burger I've had.  You order at the counter, have a seat at community tables, and they bring out the food.  Service is very friendly and "chummy." They want you to feel like you're with friends so don't be offended at sarcastic comments followed by a chuckle.  Laugh with them and you will have a good time.  We ate here twice during this business trip.  Veggie burger (order it crunchified - they add potato chips), the vegetarian salad (delicious), onion rings (fantastic), and fries (fresh and hot).  A few tips:  Tip the servers when you order.  To eat the very very tall burger, just remove the skewer and press down on the top, this compresses the chips and makes it manageable.  Highly recommend this place for a quick (and very filling) bite.

Ide2PjsYqnZlJWms-wl1YQ.text: The backside of the restaurant faces the Waldorf Astoria (nice) the frontside faces the strip, not so nice when there's homeless walking around .  Unfortunately the Waldorf Astoria and the Aria border the cheap part of the strip. Back to the food, The burger was fine, bun fell apart on the blue cheese bacon burger, but the flavor and texture of the burger was decent.  Patty was of decent thickness. I would rate Gordon Ramsey's place a little higher and this one about the same as Holsteins from a food perspective. It would be better if the place wasn't a McDonald's type atmosphere.

qGDk4sQoPJH9LVrEQX8suw.text: From the outside, Bobby's Burger Palace looks super enticing with its vibrant colors and game like charm.  I ordered the bacon bleu burger with added chips (no cost extra) and bacon cheese fries.  The burger was huge! However, I felt like the patty was dry, and I expected it to be more aesthetically pleasing. It looked like a burger patty I could buy in a pack of Costco. Overall, the burger was ok.   I didn't realize there was an assortment of sauces until after I started eating my burger so I tried it with the bacon cheese fries. I was expected crispy fries with loaded cheese and bacon. There was a light sprinkle of cheese. It was mediocre at best.  I heard Bobby Flay does come in time to time to check in, and I really think he should do some flavor quality control with this place. I expected better and I have to say I was disappointed.

The burger comes with only cheese and bacon with so little potato chips inside. The buns wasnt hot nor toasted, which I like. FtzpZvAQLrCB__lBuv4AYA.text: Burgers are so good here! I always order the same burger and I'm always happy.  The fries are so good and the sauce it comes with ...mmm. This time my burger was overcooked. I ordered medium and it came out well done but they quickly fixed it. The shakes are delicious! Thanks Bobby for being consistent! Oh and service was great!

NisnOMuyGHajFFzh2372zw.text: Let's start with the burger... perfectly cooked, perfectly shaped (thick and good structure), and extremely flavorful. If the service/vibe was terrible, I'd rate this place high anyways, BUT, the service and vibe were great.   I went with 3 other people, and we all had different burgers, and they all were unique and crafted well. The green chili burger had an amazing flavor with just enough spice, and incredible cheese.   The sweet potato fries, regular fries, and onion rings were also some of the best I've had anywhere.   The best of the whole thing? It's affordable. Prices were amazing, especially considering it's on the strip. Go and enjoy!!!

kMwFE1w2ci7Vr-TJaBtOHQ.text: This is the fourth burger place during our Vegas trip, and this is as delicious as the other ones. We came back for their fries at late night, and it was really good as well.

I ordered the special of the month burger - some murberry burger. It's supposed to come with arugula but they didn't have it so I mentioned it and they brought out some withered arugula on a plate. The burger was dry and salty. I had to add the chipotle sauce to make it more palatable.   My husband ordered the LA burger and he said his was ok; not as bad of an experience as me. He also ordered the cookies and cream shake which he liked a lot.

qeTHRvm07W655uQEfklhkA.text: Arrived early to beat crowds on the strip.  You stand in a line (almost no wait for us) and order, they give you a number and bring it out when it is ready.  I chose the Bacon Crunch Burger (Bacon, American Cheese, Potato Chips) and the Shake of the Month Cherry Blossom. My co-worker and I shared an order of Undecided (French Fries & Onion Rings).  The burger was a perfect Medium Well and has to be one of the top burgers I have had. The seasoning was very good and Bobby's Burger Sauce was a good addition. The bun was fairly mundane.  The only problem we ran into was my shake was apparently given to the wrong table and had to be remade. It took longer than I thought it should, we actually started to think that they had forgotten with a staff change.  I am not sure what was supposed to make the Shake Cherry Blossom flavored. I tasted plenty of cherry flavor and it was quite good. Not too thick, not too thin.  I would definitely make the trek back again when/if I return to Las Vegas or am near another location.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cherry Blossom Shake
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Undecided (French Fries &amp; Onion Rings)

Ug5YYBivwEo-RKB15MfzkA.text: Definately worth a repeat visit. Among my top 5 favorites for sure. Bobby Flay definately knows what a burger is supposed to be.

Q4aTuIzw2_Nu_Pblg_tsXw.text: Three of us showed up with 1.5 hours left to be at the airport to be on time to arrive 2 hours early. Not the best way to end our trip. We went here planning to eat for 30 mins and walk to our car 30 mins away. Two of my friends receive their burgers and ate them within 15 minutes. My burger didn't show up until minute 25. Plus they didn't have the ingredients they included on the menu for my burger. Decent burger. But poor service.   I asked for a box and they still took forever. I felt like they forgot about me. I am moving to Vegas in a couple months for work and will not make an extra effort to go here. Normal burger join with poor service.   They ended up offering me compensation for my experience. As a local I probably won't go back because we don't go to the strip.

X6q2bMs4F3h5nm2kzXIwIw.text: Just got to Vegas last night and hubby and I were so hungry. We walked down the strip to Bobby's Burger Palace and sat down immediately, crazy for a Saturday night, and ordered our burgers. The food was amazing! The burgers tasted so good, the fries were great and we had a great view of the strip as we ate!! I highly recommend the burgers here!

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Classic cheese burger

tvGHr9VAGkgALI9h0fvLgQ.text: March 21st 2019, dinner: I ordered the Brunch burger medium and the Undecided (fries and onion rings):   The good:   The burger was cooked perfectly as was the bun (just enough bun, unlike others) and seasoned very well .   The Onion rings were fantastic, crunchy coating nice seasoning, just right.  The OK:  The fries were good but a little soggy with grease, I prefer crunchy fries but with the fry sauce they were good.  Beer selection was just ok (at least add Miller Lite).  The bad:  the egg was cooked well done and should have been sunny side up, so no good yolk flowing over the burger.  Overall: Better than Gordon Ramsey's burger place in Planet Hollywood. However, Grill Marks at home (Greenville, SC) is as good as either of these place.  Do I recommend: yes!

cPLyB3_uJ1znDW5KzzMVVw.text: Bobby Flay. You see him on TV but you wont see him here. Unless you count all the pictures of him everywhere. We came in before the Queen concert at the Park MGM theatre on a friday about 6:30ish. Plenty of seating capacity but not very many diners. The dining room decor was very cool with continuous curvy tables. It took about 15 minutes for the food to arrive on a slow night. The onion rings were massive. The burgers were tasty but on the small side. 1 burger, order of rings and water was $20.00.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XxLqfCzOMjcN-1iIoeRIkA.text: I had been wanting to try a Bobby's Burger Palace for a long time and finally made it this last trip while in Vegas. I have to say I expected prices to be high and quality to be mediocre because it's right on the strip and you tend to get the median of things but I was so pleasantly surprised! The venue is large and can fit a good amount of people with fast service and a separate bar if you want to add drinks to your meal or hang out, rich with colors and awesome photos of Flay's creation. But let's get to the burgers.   I decided on the Bobby Blue; a thick burger with blue cheese and bacon. It came out medium rare, just the way I wanted it. I did add some roasted green chiles to the burger to add some spice and it was definitely the right call. I had split order of onion rings with fries and each was just so well made and of great quality.   Definitely a place to stop by for a burger where the focus is the burger and not the distractions. Next time I will have to add a shake!

3pMf3Dip_0k29427NxFWsg.text: Best burgers in whole Las Vegas area .. I always have my lunch & dinner here , when ever I am in Vegas . A big fan of Bobby Flay's burgers !

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7ugZotJdoRc51Murzb9Klg.text: Delish! Got there right when it opened and a small line was already forming. I ordered the Chicago burger which was sooo good, I just wish they put more off the relish on it. Fries were excellent with the fry sauce. Great service! Will def be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EGCbRqCr3DevFVTTD4iNTQ.text: I have been watching Bobby flay for twenty years finally got a chance to eat at one of his restaurants in Las Vegas. Did not disappoint truly an unbelievable burger food was top notch if you love hamburgers you have got to eat here

i7dGAr0Vja3-OOU_FlXXAw.text: One of the better lunch places in Vegas. Right on the strip with a good bar, good burgers and great television coverage. If you want to catch part of the game, still people watch and be part of the action this is a great place. A little pricey in my book but isn't most of Vegas anymore? A great variety of burgers, prepared fresh and served still hot! Both are a plus in my book. Burger was cooked to order and the variety of toppings available make a good choice.

-bvWCfZiwaEybaOHq2HumQ.text: Pretty good burgers & really good service from the bartender. I think his name was Lou. Great drinks. I'll for sure be back

DXj2ikLyxR1WY47kSzhAEQ.text: First time here. We went to order chicken patty - they were out. Veggie patty - they also ran out. So we ordered 2 regular burgers from the menu, they did come out quickly. However they were both incredibly salty, and one was so rare I had to leave the middle half of the burger it was literally raw. Was too hungry to send it back.   Would not recommend this place, we won't be back.

ax9bKQABdHU0H1uL3XDsrg.text: I was disappointed after eating Bobby's burgers. They overcooked my burger and it was quite greasy.  I also had the fries/sweet potato fries combo which was giant but also very greasy. With so many options on the Strip, I had expectations that Bobby's would be superior in so many ways.  The flavor was just so-so.

kCEj0Z0CXjVrd1c1cvvdzg.text: OMG!  Very tasty and juicy burgers!  If there were more of these BBPs closer to where I live, I'd definitely be bankrupt with all my food money going to Mr. Flay.  You just have to try!

WRydQTbXyUYunOoSm3Bk5Q.text: As most already know, I am a chef and restaurant owner and I have been featured on Food Network and Diners Drive In's & Dives. I'm not a burger guy because I don't like my hands getting juices on them when I'm eating, I'm a fork & knife kind of guy.   But since I went to Wahlburgers last week and  I'm back in Las Vegas, and Chef Bobby Flay is one of my all time favorite Chefs, I had to try this joint.  We were there at 11am ready to chow down.  Well again Bobby did not let us down, everything was awesome (as expected) and when I left all I could thing about is what I wanted to get on my next visit.  The location is set outside of Aria Casino so it's easy to get in and out, the place is very clean and open.  My only suggestion was the French Fries (which are skin on) were a bit over cooked for my liking but still very good. I got the Philly Burger with Grilled onions, hot peppers and Provolone. Kailey order the Green Chili burger which had pickles, onions and green chilies with cheese. We also got the undecided which was french fries and fresh fried thick batter red onion rings, yeah it was awesome.  You want one of the best burgers in town (it's the best I have found so far) then Bobby's Burger Palace is the place for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iEum98O6Bys1T0yWNhAV-A.text: Celebrity burgers on the Strip! How does it get better than this? They offer a great value and a tasty burger. The service at the bar was above expectations. I tried the secret burger- shhhhh! It is wonderful and not on the menu. I'll see you there!

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautifully prepared medium rare, with chips.

kOqt2BMIVFd_7FMucw2caQ.text: Husband and I went to have a few drinks today and were impressed all the way around, food was amazing and so were the drinks! Our bar tender was Lou he was Awesome, my husband and I had a great time will definitely be going back to visit our new friend at the bar! Thank you Lou for your great service!

JJ7JNEx_UhojhXsRoixZGA.text: This place was soooo good! My fiance and I got the Crunch Burger,  Louisiana Burger and Fries with cheese and bacon. The meat was bomb and it's cheap for Vegas. I would come here again on my next visit to Vegas for sure.

tuRnzVm1z0INHdE77oH73w.text: This place was amazing, I loved the food and the service from Mike and Ryan. I'm personally not a fan of Bobby Flay as for Gordon Ramsay is my favorite chef. So by any chance if Gordon reads this I'm sorry for eating here. If Bobby reads this take the challenge and have a cook off in Vegas against Gordon I'll pay top dollar for that. Anyways the food was good, and again the service from Mike and Ryan was great. I love how chips were added to my burger.

2PY7bnBo8Bwq8A6RjIcOaA.text: About a year later, stopped in to Bobby's Palace again and it was just as good as the last time.  This time I have the New Mexico burger, with special sauce and green chilies (pictured).   Everything is good here. Live a little and try something a little different. Don't just get a basic burger with catchup and mustard.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

9CtfxSiKQkEZ_eKAExhYyQ.text: I've been wanting to go here for quite a while & it was just alright. I ordered the Palace classic burger medium rare - it was more rare than I would have liked it.. there wasn't any condiments on it so it was pretty tasteless & the blood from the meat being medium rare was overwhelming. My husband ordered the brunch burger & he loved it. We also ordered the fries with cheese, bacon & scallions which were just okay. The prices weren't the same as they are online, overall everything was overpriced in my opinion.

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nVi9_MBPbnrNVttqpy9WIA.text: Very nice casual burger place. Simple delicious good quality burger with all the trimmings. The sauces are awesome. They serve all kinds of beer and wine. The purple Margarita was fantastic. The menu is designed to choose everything al a carte. So you can have beef, chicken or veggie burger. I recommend to order the onion rings as well. They don't give you any utensils. must wash your hands before you leave cause it will become messy. If you are looking for a quick delicious burger that is very reasonable this is it. Parking is a little inconvenient and takes a little walking which will help you digest the burger. I was expecting a little more exotic combo burgers but overall, good job Bobby Flay.

pL-2ybHAE4x-N16SRjTyOA.text: Seriously the best burger in Las Vegas! Our bartender was great and very nice! Great location on the strip with very quick service and delicious food! Decent prices for Vegas eatery!

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

8KbOAXX0EF4ROKkN0NHu2w.text: Burger was way way way too salty. My husband tried my burger and agreed. Said if he would have known he would have had them remake it. Instead I ate most of it (because I was so damn hungry) and now I'm soooo thirsty.   The strawberry malted shake is good though.

SZcoD-gHavXgT2F07sV38w.text: The food is good. The prices are quite high for the small serving sizes you get. A milkshake that is about 8 ounces is $7 plus tax. Two came to $15.05. Our total dinner bill was over $38 for two small milkshakes, one small hamburger and one small arugula salad (that was really a spinach salad with a couple of arugula leaves thrown in).

photos.caption: Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Bobby's Burger Palace - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4UkQ8UOM6ImbFYkp8C1Umw.text: First: no gluten free bun and NO lettuce wrap option. WTF Bobby???  Spend a dollar and buy a head of butter lettuce. It's not that hard. We shouldn't have to tell you this stuff.  My "Crunchburger" served "open face" like an effing salad had dressing on the side (which I specifically told them not to do) and NO CHIPS. Seriously? You're the one who called it a Crunchburger, Bobby. When I pointed this out, the server brought me a TINY condiment dish with a few chips and some crumbs in it.  Bad service may be acceptable in New York, but in Vegas there are better options. I recommend you try them. In-N-Out is just down the street...

BofEcCiw2ESdRFCptfp0AQ.text: Good burgers. Good price too for Vegas. I was disappointed by the cheese fries. They drenched them in cheese sauce which just gets gross and soupy and really ruins it. So get the burger and a fry without cheese haha

Wjk2FSnmxbKzUVUYZMLy3g.text: I was very happy to come here when I finally went to Vegas. I've always wanted to go to a hobby flay restaurant. I will visit again when I come back. Burgers with potatoes chips on them!? Whoda thought it would've been amazing.

wxQ5g24JAtYpWQmmE8MdNA.text: Just tried this and really liked my medium burger.   The size was right, the toppings were right, and the price was right.  Very satisfying.  Would go back there again!

SAzW84FTBSwaet5IXJNA-g.text: This was disappointing. We had visited here last year and it was much better. The burgers were kinda sad. Toppings not very fresh, patties a little dry, buns too soft, and the shakes we're watery. The strawberry shake was all syrup, no berry. The fries were mediocre. They have better fries at the burger place in Aria. Not what we expected from a Bobby Flay-branded burger joint. We won't visit again.

WO_7uqMswDg0ij6bTnEjDg.text: One of my favorite burger places in Vegas thus far! All the flavors just meld together so well. And of course you gotta add the chips! Game changer.

LxXfdpbVJm-DILUFqdDtuQ.text: We came here while we were in Vegas on vacation, and Id have to say Bobby Burgers are very tasty. They are a great size portion with fries and a drink.   The price is average for this type of place in Vegas, the service was great no lines food was ready very quickly and we had sports on at the bar.

xMDdXbos-uJuwnhkYfB5JQ.text: I'm conflicted on this review.  Went here before the Knights game and just didn't enjoy it.  Plenty of burger choices, fries were amazing, and the onion rings and dips were great.   Sat by the kitchen first in the serpentine bars.  Nice concept that lets people sit and interact but was too hot from lights and kitchen.   Moved to a more standard table.  We ordered before we sat down but service was slow.  Server was nice but overwhelmed either by deliveries or a kitchen that was slow.  Had to get our own silverware, served burgers first and didn't see fries/rings until much later.  I had already eaten my burger.  Had to ask for my drink (beer) after I had finished eating since the food was a drop and run.  Onion rings came in a large pile that turned out to be only four deep, they were placed on top of a tin cup.  Was shocked to see how few there were.   Probably won't head back.

1EovWV7fFG3AqLELValc9A.text: I ordered the green Chile burger and onion rings to go. Burger cooked a perfect medium. It was a little spicy w/ the Chiles partially offset by the great pickled onions queso cheese and burger sauce (which I added). Onions rings with ranch on the side were fantastic. Great place, will visit again to try a different burger !
